intro: Onosma polioxantha, commonly known as the Kashmiri sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Onosma polioxantha is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of mountainous ecosystems.
